column5: Greetings and salutations, Taking my wife to Red Pine Lodge on Lady Evelyn on August 25 for a week,and need a couple of hot spots to start us off. Any advise would be greatly appreciated.  Thanx,

Straight across the lake to American point for jigging in the evening.. as you come in there is a bunch of stumps and an island to the right...troll past the right side of the stumps and turn along the island a couple hundred yards and circle around
I put a bunch of hotspots on the Angler's Atlas map.  Someone just put a short report up on Walleye Central as well.  Could as the OP - fishincrazy.  IIRC the bay west Red Pine was a good night spot.
I'd start with a glass or two of wine, maybe some soft music...

Thanx  for the help. Much appreciated. as far as the wine and soft music my wife says and I quote "skip the wine and music and load the boat, we have walleye to slay!!!! " This time next week, we will be following your advise,  Tightlines
LOL you gotta love that! Take her fishing and have a great time! Good luck.
